content.description: Zoom Sesh is another one of the warm-ups, probably the easiest. Start in the huecos in the center of the pictured face. Go straight up from there.
content.location: It is in the center of the boulder face. The front of this boulder has a huge bulge near the top.

content.description:
The Undertaker is the low sit to

The Crypt

.

Video beta of the FA:

https://youtu.be/fwwZe3v4N9A

.
content.location:
Start on the oblivious rail below and left of the start rail for

Mobile Morgue

and

The Crypt

.

content.description:
Sit start the same as for

BB8

, move up, and traverse left under the steepest part of the boulder. Continue traversing left around the next rounded arete and then above three consecutive boulders before finally topping out above the third boulder.

This is on the north side of the huge boulder at Corona Crag in the hobo slot cave. It is really cool. Start on the obvious crimp rail low, do a short left hand move to a small quarter pad edge, and then do a hard, deadpoint bump to a better edge closer to the lip. Top out.

Video beta:

https://youtu.be/6PCkST7-WSo

.
content.location: It is on the north side of the huge boulder in the little corridor.

climbs.name: North South East West Arete Face

content.description: Start matched on the lowest shelf in the bottom right corner. The crux is low, on the first few moves. This is a little bit highball, but it finishes on easy jugs.
content.location: This is on the biggest freestanding boulder on the side facing you as you walk up.

content.description:
Begin matched on obvious low rail, the foot for the stand, climb directly into

Mobile Morgue

, adding difficult hand setup sequence, and finish the same.

Mobile Morgue has really steep and hard first 3 moves to a really nice victory topout. Start in the crimp seam right where the roof turns, and do a very difficult deadpoint to the seam.

Video beta:

https://youtu.be/Y1Xfdaf2RSs

.
content.location: It is on the south side of the huge bloc at the Corona Crag.

content.description: Mask Off is a fun highball to the left of harder problems. Start on the lowest ledge, pull a few fun overhang moves, and finish on some easy slab straight up. This is located on the center right face of the large, freestanding boulder.
content.location: Walk up the trail. When you see the freestanding boulder, it's the route that goes up almost in the middle.

content.description: Start way to the right. On decent holds. Don't top out immediately. Head left avoiding the top of the boulder's jugs and rails until you round the corner. Then top out straight up. Right heel hook follows you through the problem.
content.location: It is downhill from the other boulders and just off the main Mitchell Creek Canyon Trail.

content.description: Start matched on a sloper crimp rail, campus up to a big hold, then work your hands/feet up and over. Donâ€™t use the obviously loose blocks, but the big jug sticking out seemed pretty solid for now.
content.location:
It is below

Creek Beach

towards the canyon.

content.description: Start on a low shelf. Head up and slightly left to two huge pebbles. Do a tough mantel topout from there.
content.location: This boulder is at the end of the first side trail. When going down the dirt canyon path, cross the bridge, then head left on the trail by the bench. Check the picture for clarity. This boulder isn't truly in the Corona Crag area; it's actually a bit before it.

content.description: SDS far left on decent slopers. Pop a left heel hook, keep moving right, and don't top out till you round the corner. The crux is long reach around the corner.
content.location: It is on a roof boulder just past the main area.

content.description: SDS on a hollow flake. Place your feet there too, maybe heel hooked. Head up to small crimp pocket, then top out around the corner.
content.location: It is on the back of the boulder that is opposite the big freestanding boulder.

content.description:
Half Life is the low, low start to

Mobile Morgue

.

Video beta:

https://youtu.be/pgPgaPBLkY4

.
content.location:
Start on the low left rail below the start rail for

Mobile Morgue

.

content.description:
Start matched on

Overreacting

, and bust out

right

and straight up on a thin gaston, crimps, and an interesting topout sequence.

The Crypt is the direct finish to

Mobile Morgue

. It is amazing and adds a V7 exit with a little spice!

Video of the FA:

https://youtu.be/tLogJ1b5_Sc

.
content.location:
Do the same start as for

Mobile Morgue

.

content.description: Start sitting low left with your right hand in sloping dish and your left hand on your choice of holds - traverse up right via slopers and pinches to the apex. This bloc will clean up over time. It is quite sandy still.
content.location:
From

Mobile Morgue

, go left and over boulders for about 50 yards.

content.description: This whole boulder face is full of V0s good for warming up. This one starts on the far right side of the boulder and heads straight up on nice crimps.
content.location: This is on the boulder face opposite the big, freestanding boulder.

content.description:
Sit start with your left hand in a slot and your right hand on the crumbly, pinch rail. Pull on, and reach your right hand to a shallow dish, adjust your feet, then reach your left hand to a good slot. Heel-hook, then match. Bump your left hand over to a 3-finger in the horizontal, and adjust your right hand. Bump your left foot up, and do a big move to the dragon's lip with your left hand. Adjust your left foot, move your right foot up and right, then reach your right hand to 3-finger hold to the right. Get a high left foot hold, and do a big move to 4-finger chip and the finishing jug up and right.

Yee-haw!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=czJ0zRspDiU

.
Anti-Social Distancing is a bit of a one move wonder. Start on the two crimp rails. Smear your feet, and try to make the powerful move straight up.
content.location: This is on the tall, upright boulder that looks like it could fall onto the trail someday. As you head up, you'll see it in a copse of trees on your right.

content.description: Start way to the right. SDS on decent holds. Don't top out immediately. Head left avoiding the top of the boulder's jugs and rails until you round the corner. Then top out above the nose. Right heel hooks follow you through the problem.
content.location: Go behind the large free standing boulder in the center of Corona Crag. This boulder is further down the path and behind it.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
